lines.text: This new command is an illusion. Give it up.

I am Martin Hessler. Four years ago, my panzers overran Poland in one week, that was no illusion. In 39 days, my tanks smashed all the way to Paris, that was no illusion. I conquered the Crimea, that was no illusion. Today, I was given a brigade of Tiger tanks. When I have a brigade of tanks, THAT is reality.
Here's your half, 320 dollars, now what'd you make?
1,230 dollars.
Oh? Whatta you been sellin? I don't see much stock gone.
Take it.
I won't take it until I know how you made it. What do you think I am?
What do you think I am?
Release the boy... Shoot the father!
Germans are still the best toy makers in the World!
Our column has made the farthest advance! We have outrun the other Panzers! The eyes of Germany are on us! The Fuhrer himself will decorate me. We have done it Conrad! We have done it!
Then I was wrong. We have won the war.
No.
You mean we have lost?
No.
I don't understand. If we have not won, and we have not lost, than what is happening?
The best thing possible is happening - the war will go on.
For how long?
Indefinitely. On, and on, and on!
But it must come to an end.
You're a fool Conrad. Those of us who understood knew in 1941 that we could never win.
You mean Colonel for three years we have been fighting without any hope of victory?
There are many kinds of victory. For the German Army to survive, for us to remain in uniform - that is our victory. Conrad, the world is not going to get rid of us after all.
But, when do we go home?
This is our home.
And my sons? When do I see them? What will become of them?
They will become German soldiers, and you will be proud of them.
[pause]
Conrad, do you still have any of those delicacies left you offered me at Ambleve?
Yes, sir.
Prepare them for me. I'm in very good appetite!
[Music]
They have the fuel and planes to fly Cake over the Atlantic Ocean.
Do you know what this means?
Where do you think you're going?
To the shelter.
No you're not. Grab your rifles and come with me.
But we're cooks!

[pauses]
Lunch is over! Grab your rifles!
A lot of guys are gonna die to keep you safe and cozy.
You sure know how to hit below the belt, Colonel... that's dirty fighting.
This isn't a pillow fight, Joe... sorry it hurts.

[speaking to U.S. Army M.P.s he knew were Germans in disguise at the fuel supply camp, in a sarcastic voice]
Does the road to Amblève still lead to Malmedy?
[then he shoots them]
I do not kill prisoners, but I would have no compunction at shooting you myself for your last remark.
Then do it!

[Kiley is selecting men for a night patrol]
I'll take that sergeant.
OK. But I'll pick the rest of your volunteers.
The Russian Front does not put meat on a man's bones.
If we were a hundred feet higher, I'd jump and leave you here.
General Kohler says we are behind schedule. He wants to know what's holding us up.
Tell the general the Americans are learning how to retreat.
Field Marshall Goering himself gave me that painting. Lovely, isn't it?
I imagine he found a bargain in Paris last year.
The truth... is that I'm a fool. I believed in you, but all that you believe in, is the war. You have the war, you like the war. And all I have are my sons and I don't want to lose them.
I am not responsible for your children.
You are. You would make them soldiers.
Yes, and they will fight.
And they will die?
If necessary.
Necessary for who? For you?
You are not only a fool, you are a traitor.
And you are a murderer! You would murder my sons. You would murder my country. You would murder the whole world, to stay in that uniform.
I did not lose a war to die in the back seat of a car.
It's like hitting them with tennis balls!
Hold it hold it, pull up, we got brass on our tail, pull it forward you idiot!
[mutters under his breath to the officers]
Drop dead.
[then back to his driver]
Pull it forward you idiot!

[after kissing Louise goodbye]
Don't forget to feed the chickens.
They've made mistakes before. Where've they made one this time?
Well, they got me mad at them.
From the American commander of Bastogne to the German commander. Nuts. Nuts.
What am I doing up here? It's like flying inside a light bulb.

You listen to me Colonel,there are survivors in all massacres. And I warn you, if any of my men are harmed, you will be held responsible. There'll be no place on this earth that you can hide, and when you're found, I hope I'm the man that ties the rope around your neck.
Burn it!
